TEXT: The applicant is a NORP national . He was born in DATE and lives in FAC . He was represented before the ORG by Mr PERSON , of FAC .

On DATE the applicant was stopped by police for an identity check and taken to the police station where he claims to have been insulted and assaulted . On being released , he went to hospital where he was kept in after being examined . At TIME a doctor came into his room saying that he was a forensic medical examiner and had come to examine the applicant at the public prosecutor ’s request . The applicant refused to submit to the examination and left the hospital to go to a private clinic .

On DATE the applicant lodged a criminal complaint with the investigating judge alleging assault in the course of his duties by a person exercising public authority , and trespass by the forensic medical examiner . He sought leave to join the proceedings as a civil party seeking damages . On DATE the investigating judge issued an order finding that there was no case to answer . The applicant appealed . ORG upheld the order in a judgment of CARDINAL DATE . The applicant appealed on points of law against that judgment . In a judgment of DATE , ORG declared the appeal inadmissible on the ground that the applicant had not made out “ any complaint that a civil party may lodge under LAW in support of an appeal against the decision of ORG in the absence of an appeal by the prosecution ” .
“ A civil party shall be barred from lodging an appeal on points of law against judgments of ORG unless the prosecution lodges an appeal .
However , an appeal on points of law by the civil party above shall be admissible in the following circumstances :
CARDINAL . where ORG has stated in the judgment that there are no grounds for an investigation ;
CARDINAL . NORP where ORG has declared the civil party ’s action inadmissible ;
CARDINAL . where ORG has upheld an objection terminating the criminal proceedings ;
CARDINAL . where ORG has declared , of its own motion , or on an objection by the parties , that it has no jurisdiction ;
CARDINAL . where ORG has omitted to rule on a charge ;
CARDINAL . where the judgment does not formally satisfy the conditions essential for its legal validity ;
CARDINAL . where a breach of personal rights as defined in ORG CARDINAL - CARDINAL to CARDINAL - CARDINAL and CARDINAL - CARDINAL to CARDINAL of LAW has been alleged . ”
